fields.Translation: Hello, i am Julian Kuqi. I am an Albanian of Albania, who has been living in Pristina for 3 years. I am the only son of the family, i am the 5th child, i have 2 older sisters who most of the time havent been with me, they have both studied in Italy, they re much more older than me. According to the data of an English institute, if im not mistaken, the origin of my family is from the Albanians of Montenegro, before 5 or 6 centuries, then from there, they came down to ShkodÃ«r, where they named the place they settled in, Kuq, just like my last name Kuqi. After that, since it is said that we have been a very problematic tribe, aghas (ottoman title) from the region moved us from there and gave us land and took us to a place who nowadays is called Karadak of Kosovo. Karadak in Montenegro (correction) Karadak in Turkish means Montenegro, Karadak, and actually it is said that the first from our tribe who went there on that land gave it the name Karadak. Then, from there they settled down to DibÃ«r, in Peshkopi and they continued there, it is where my father is from, actually i was also born there but never lived. The city of Peshkopi in DibÃ«r is in north-eastern Albania. In 2011 i moved to Pristina, because my father has been working and living here for 13 years. It is a rare occassion, because usually it is the opposite, there are many people from here who live and study there. Another interesting fact of my family is the religion, our religions are very mixed, because my mother is orthodox christian, relatively devoted, she celebrates the religious celebrations, lights candles and goes to the church. My father is a devoted muslim, who prays if not 5,  3 times whenever he has the chance. I have chosen to be catholic, not devoted but still a catholic. Whereas my sisters are some sort of christians....they are monotheist and thats it. Speaking of linguistics and dialects, language is one of the most artificial things that we have, it is a pure agreement there is nothing natural in it. Except a phenomenon, that i cant remember its name, its a phenomenon that based from the sounds that they make (not sure what he s talking about here, the letters probably) they take their name from and this is the most natural thing, speaking of the language. But like this, it is just an agreement, and as an agreement i think that the Albanian language needs to be adapted more with the dialects, in order for the standard language and the vocabulary of 1972 to be refreshed because of many political reasons. Anyway, today the standard language is very exclusive, to cut it short, it excludes many words that sound much better in the Arvanitika dialect, Tosk dialect, Gheg dialect or even ArbÃ«resh. Speaking of them, they are a very big asset of Albanians especially when it comes to the language and linguistics. And with this i will end, saying that the language is a pure agreement between people, we could call a couch, shoe and the opposite etc. And since it is an agreement, it is an artifical thing that we could integrate more in our everyday lives and routines.ï»¿
Demographics: 1,630,000 in Serbia. Population total all countries: 3,486,100. Ethnic population: 2,000,000 (1998 Los Angeles Times).
